titleStmt.title: A True narrative of all the proceedings against the weavers, at a court of oyer and terminer, held at Justice-Hall in the Old Bayly upon the same occasion, on Thursday the 16th of September 1675 with an account of the manner of their deportment there, and also of the punishments allotted to them for their offence : how many are to be fined, and how many to stand in the pillory.

A True narrative of all the proceedings against the weavers, at a court of oyer and terminer, held at Justice-Hall in the Old Bayly upon the same occasion, on Thursday the 16th of September 1675 with an account of the manner of their deportment there, and also of the punishments allotted to them for their offence : how many are to be fined, and how many to stand in the pillory.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in: British Library.
